content.description: Welcome Home is a technical thin tips seam on textured solid rock.  It is fairly sustained and requires good footwork because the tips jams are so bad.
content.protection: One bomber bolt and a medium nut for backup.
content.location: Hike up to California Night and take a right skirting the base of the big chimney boulder.  Do not drop down into the gulley with the fallen dead trees; instead, take another right ducking low under tree branches eventually emerging into a clearing with a huge chimney blocking your way.  Jump across the chimney and walk across the flat rock platform.  Welcome Home is in the corridor straight ahead with the bolt at your feet.

content.description: Thin hard start leads to leftward traverse and easier climbing up to top.
content.location: 10 feet left of Patchouli face.  Starts up the middle of the face.  Hippy cave area

content.description: Thin face on high quality rock on the right side, just left of the bald arête up to the weakness(thin crack) at the top.
content.location: Hippy cave area (Welcome Home), outside on the left.

content.description: Desperate friction up the rounded arête.
content.location: The arête just right of Patchouli face.

content.description:
This is one of a pair of   face climbs   that are hidden behind the big split boulder that sits behind California Night.  Follow the trail to Ca. Night but take a right at the end of the trail.  Follow along the base of the boulder, and 2nd class up next to the fallen tree and this face is visible.

Private location with stellar rock and cool moves on positive holds, makes this a classic for the grade.

The name is for reference only, as no documentation of the climbs could be ascertained at the time of this description.  My belay partners were munching them!
content.protection: 1 bolt, and a boulder to sling as well.

content.description: This sterling route climbs a steep finger crack for about 15 feet.  A couple of good ring locks lead to a typical Woodson top-out crux.  Those comfortable at the grade can easily boulder this, otherwise for the rest of us two bolts at the top provide an anchor for this classic problem.
content.location: After rounding the corner from the Uncertainty Principle Area, e.g., Pickpocket, continue past a heavily chalked "blasted boulder" to a tight left switchback.  Looking up and to the right from this corner is a wide offwidth crack, beneath which, and not seen from the road, is California Night.  Follow the trail from the road in, up and right to this gem!

content.description:
From California Night, head directly towards the crack, scramble through some bushes and start the crack from the left side. Climb on top of a flake/block that sits in the crack. Once on top of the block, down climb into the crack. Start Chimneying. Notice that the crack does not look that tall from outside. Inside however, you see that the rock goes into the ground and it is a long drop.

Unless you want to protect this with a Big Bro, this climb is most easily just soloed. Once you are in it, is quite secure. The chimney is the perfect size to jam your knee and take a rest anytime.
content.location:
This is the large crack right next California Night. You can see it from the road.

Down climb left off the boulder.
